thread.title: Gov. Snyder helps inaugurate Detroit riverfront's Outdoor Adventure Center, tests simulations
thread.title_full: Gov. Snyder helps inaugurate Detroit riverfront's Outdoor Adventure Center, tests simulations - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Gov. Snyder helps inaugurate Detroit riverfront's Outdoor Adventure Center, tests simulations
text:
DETROIT - Gov. Rick Snyder has helped mark the opening of the state's new Outdoor Adventure Center in downtown Detroit.
The new Department of Natural Resources facility is near the Detroit River opposite the William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor. Snyder spoke at Thursday's opening ceremony, with Boy and Girl Scouts and young children among the several hundred participants.

The interior of the Department of Natural Resources Outdoor Adventure Center is viewed Thursday, July 16, 2015, in Detroit. The new facility is near the Detroit River opposite the William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor. The three-story, 41,000-square-foot indoor facility features hands-on, interactive exhibits including a 40-foot-tall artificial tree. (AP Photo/Carlos Osorio) 
Snyder says he got a diverse simulated outdoors experience in half an hour.
The three-story, 41,000-square-foot indoor facility features interactive exhibits including a 40-foot-tall artificial tree.
It has off-road vehicle, bicycle, kayak, canoe and fishing boat simulators, a life-size beaver lodge, eagle's nest, 3,000-gallon aquarium and 36-foot waterfall.
Admission is $5 for adults, $3 for seniors and $3 for children 2-12. Children under 2 enter free.
